When a teenage boy desperately needs a heart transplant on Christmas Eve, 
his family and neighbors' forty-year tradition of lining their quaint street 
with Christmas luminaries is put on hold. When his parents, Ann and Mike, 
pray for a donor on a stormy night, the neighbors suddenly realize their 
luminaries could have a deeper purpose.
